intro: Hesperethusa acidissima, commonly known as the sour apple tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with a glossy green surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by round, sour-tasting berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is occasionally cultivated in subtropical regions.
